RecordThing.Description: While countless 'better' ways of cooking <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:FoodPage;Food}</color> have been invented in the last few hundred years, few are as durable or easy to fabricate as the OK-Zoomer microwave. Licensed from <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Xigo;Xigo}</color>, the plans are based on a classic model from the mid-21st century, giving it a charmingly retro feel. But don't worry, it oscillates water molecules more than adequately. Just bolt it to a {THING:StructureBench} using a {THING;ItemWrench} to power it, follow the recipe, and you're cooking.

Sitting somewhere between a high powered juicer and an alchemist's alembic, the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Xigo;Xigo}</color> reagent processor turns certain raw materials and food items into cooking and crafting ingredients. Indispensible in any space kitchen, just bolt it to the bench, and you're ready to go.
As far as left arms go, this is an acceptable, if slightly forgettable example of its kind. It's seen better days.

RecordThing.Value: Body Part Astronaut Female Arm R
RecordThing.Description: One of a pair. The other is probably nearby.
If the eyes are windows to the soul, what does that make the head?
A leg, is a leg, is a leg.

RecordThing.Value: Body Part Astronaut Female Leg R
RecordThing.Description: This is a woman's right leg. To judge by its state, she was fairly healthy, of average height, with a tendency to walk on the balls of her feet.
This isn't going anywhere by itself.
Your arm is your fourth most important body part.

RecordThing.Value: Body Part Astronaut Male Arm R
RecordThing.Description: There's nothing funny about this humerus.
<color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color>s need to keep their heads at all times.
This is a leg. Someone probably misses it.

RecordThing.Value: Body Part Astronaut Male Leg R
RecordThing.Description: Legs are really useful things, but wheels would have been cool.
Once, this was most of someone.
The fluffy heart of a harmless proto-hen.
Let's not over-complicate things. It's a chicken.
A chicken head is useful for many things, but principally voodoo and space curses.
A chicken leg.

RecordThing.Value: Body Part Chicken Brown Leg R
RecordThing.Description: Also a chicken leg.
A chicken's tail is arguably its least endearing feature.
A chicken wing.

RecordThing.Value: Body Part Chicken Brown Wing R
RecordThing.Description: A chicken wing.
Part of a chicken.
A chicken's head. Once used as currency by long-departed alien races.
A chicken leg.

RecordThing.Value: Body Part Chicken White Leg R
RecordThing.Description: A chicken leg.
A chicken tail.
It's a chicken wing.

RecordThing.Value: Body Part Chicken White Wing R
RecordThing.Description: A chicken wing.
The head of a chicken. Once, it had the heart of a tiger.
A chicken leg.
A chicken leg.
A chicken's tail.
A chicken wing.
A chicken wing.
An alien's arm.
An alien's arm.
An alien's body, or a very convincing fake.
An alien's head.
An alien's leg.
An alien's other leg.
An alien's pelvis.
A rooster's body.
A rooster's head. The perfect gift for mother's day.
A rooster's leg.

RecordThing.Value: Body Part Rooster Black Leg R
RecordThing.Description: A rooster's leg.
A rooster's tail.
A rooster's wing.

RecordThing.Value: Body Part Rooster Black Wing R
RecordThing.Description: A rooster's wing.
A rooster's body.
The head of a brown rooster.
A brown rooster's leg.

RecordThing.Value: Body Part Rooster Brown Leg R
RecordThing.Description: A rooster's leg.
A rooster's tail.
A rooster's wing.

RecordThing.Value: Body Part Rooster Brown Wing R
RecordThing.Description: A brown rooster's wing. Well, brownish.

The Lorenz atmos analyzer is a multi-functional mass-spectrometer designed by <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ExMin;ExMin}</color> for use with the OreCore {THING:ItemTablet}. It displays the pressure, concentration and molar quantity of <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;Gas}</color> in rooms, tanks, or pipe networks.

When added to the OreCore {THING:ItemTablet}, <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Asura;Asura's}</color>'s ReadyMed medical analyzer reveals the health, or otherwise, of users various organs. Due to a design flaw, older models were notorious for producing quasar-like levels of x-ray radiation. Recent advances in shielding have more than halved the risk to users.

A minor masterpiece of micro-electronic engineering, the network analyzer displays the current, voltage and wattage of a cable network, as well as any devices connected to it. Based on a widely-copied <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai}</color> design, it's used in conjunction with the OreCore {THING:ItemTablet}.
This is you.

When added to a {THING:StructureConsole}, air control circuit boards allow you to program an {THING:StructureActiveVent}. As with small dogs and 83% of people, air control circuits have only three modes: Pressure, Draft and Offline. Pressure mode maintains a 100kPa atmosphere, switching the active vent between inward and outward flow until target pressure is achieved. Draft mode allows you to pair active vents to circulate air. Offline mode deactivates the vent.

Rumored to have been first sketched on a <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Norsec;Norsec}</color> toilet wall by a disgruntled engineer, the Exgress airlock control circuit board’s versatility and ease of fabrication has made it the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}</color> control system of choice for {THING:StructureAirlock} cycling protocols.
To enter setup mode, insert the board into a {THING:StructureConsole} along with a data disk. In this mode, you can see all data-accessible objects currently connected to the {THING:StructureConsole}. Doors, lights, gas sensors and slave consoles can be selected (highlighted green), and will be controlled once the data disk is removed.

Surveillance is sometimes necessary when building bases in highly hostile environments. The camera display circuit board allows wary Stationeers to turn a {THING:StructureConsole} into a security display when connected to a {THING:StructureCamera}.

A basic tool of <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> base construction, this circuit board provides a way to open and close a {THING:StructureCompositeDoor}, {THING:StructureBlastDoor} or {THING:StructureGlassDoor} remotely, when connected to a {THING:StructureConsole}. This system can be further linked to {THING:StructureMotionSensor} to create automatic doors.

Information is power. Place this circuitboard into a {THING:StructureConsole} to create a display that shows gas pressure or temperature of any connected tank, storage cannister, {THING:ItemPipeAnalyizer} or {THING:ItemGasSensor}.
Can't decide which mode you love most? This circuit board allows you to switch any connected device between operation modes.

Under distant suns and demanding environments, <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> systems need to balance reliability, resilience and versatility. The power control board allows remote enabling and disabling of selected devices, disconnecting manual operation.
The circuit board has two modes: 'Link' switches all devices on or off; 'Toggle' switches each device to their alternate state.

When the original <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> Handbook collapsed under its own weight into a singularity, certain information was irretrievably lost. Amongst this mysterious corpus of knowledge is the exact purpose of the ship display board.
Adding a solar control board to a {THING:StructureConsole} lets you manually control the horizontal and vertical angles of any connected {THING:StructureSolarPanel}.

The <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai}</color>-designed Huxi portable air conditioner cools by drawing heat from the atmosphere and storing it, or adding heat to the atmosphere from its internal tank. With a max internal pressure of 8106kPa, its capacity is relatively limited, physics being clear on this subject. To extend its temperature storage ability, bolt the Huxi to a {THING:StructureTankConnector}, then connect it to a pipe network supplying hot or cold <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;gases}</color>.

The humble dynamic crate has become a symbol of <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> invention and independence. With twelve slots and handles at either end for ease of carriage, it's both standard issue and critical kit for cadets and Commanders alike.

Portable gas tanks do one thing: store gas. But there's lots you can do with them. To refill the tank, bolt it to a {THING:ItemTankConnector}, then connect it to a pipe network. Try to avoid pushing it above 10 MPa, or bad things happen. Once it's full, you can refill a {THING:ItemGasCanisterOxygen} by attaching it to the tank's striped section. Or you could vent the tank's variable flow rate valve into a room and create an atmosphere. They also attach to rovers and rockets. Alternatively, kick it over and practice barrel rolling. The possiblities are endless.

Portable gas tanks do one thing: store gas. To refill the tank, bolt it to a {THING:ItemTankConnector}, then connect it to a pipe network. Try to avoid pushing it above 10 MPa, or ... boom. Once it's full, you can refill a {THING:ItemGasCanisterCarbonDioxide} by attaching it to the tank's striped section. Or you could vent the tank's variable flow rate valve into a room and create an atmosphere ... of sorts.

Portable gas tanks store gas. To refill one, bolt it to a {THING:ItemTankConnector}, then connect it to a pipe network. Try to avoid pushing it above 10 MPa, or bad things happen. Once it's full, you can refill a {THING:ItemGasCanisterEmpty} by attaching it to the tank's striped section. Or you could vent the tank's variable flow rate valve into a room and create an atmosphere.

Portable tanks store gas. They're good at it. If you need to refill a tank, bolt it to a {THING:ItemTankConnector}, then connect it to a pipe network. Try to avoid pushing it above 10 MPa, or things get messy. You can refill a {THING:ItemGasCanisterFuel} by attaching it to the tank's striped section. Or you could use a {THING:ItemWrench} to attach it to a rover or rocket for later. It's really up to you.

Portable tanks store gas. If you need to refill a tank, bolt it to a {THING:ItemTankConnector} using a {THING:ItemWrench}, then connect it to a pipe network. Try to avoid pushing it above 10 MPa, or you'll end up with nitrogen in places you weren't expecting. You can refill a {THING:ItemGasCanisterNitrogen} by attaching it to the tank's striped section. Or you could use a {THING:ItemWrench} to attach it to a rover or rocket for later.

Portable tanks store gas. If you need to refill a tank, bolt it to a {THING:ItemTankConnector} using a {THING:ItemWrench}, then connect it to a pipe network. Try to avoid pushing it above 10 MPa, or you'll be picking tank shards out of your face. You can refill a {THING:ItemGasCanisterOxygen} by attaching it to the tank's striped section. Or you could vent it into a sealed room to create an atmosphere. Or even paint it pink, call it Steve and fill that sad space in your heart.

Portable tanks store gas. To refill one, bolt it to a {THING:ItemTankConnector} using a {THING:ItemWrench}, then connect it to a pipe network. Don't fill it above 10 MPa, unless you're the sort who loves complicated, flammable emergencies. You can refill a {THING:ItemGasCanisterVolatiles} by attaching it to the tank's striped section. Or you could use a {THING:ItemWrench} to attach to a rocket and show it around the Solar System.

This portable tank stores liquid, and liquid only. You can bolt one to a {THING:ItemTankConnector} using a {THING:ItemWrench}, then connect it to {THING:StructurePipeLiquidStraight} to supply liquid to a network. But try to keep pressure under 10 MPa, or you'll end up wet, hurt and sorry, without any of the fun. You can refill a {THING:ItemGasCanisterWater} by attaching it to the tank's striped section. Or you could use a {THING:ItemWrench} to attach it to a rocket and take it somewhere distant and dry, then feel good about yourself.

This portable tank stores liquid, and liquid only. You can bolt one to a {THING:ItemTankConnectorLiquid} using a {THING:ItemWrench}, then connect it to a pipe network to refill it. You can refill a {THING:ItemGasCanisterWater} by attaching it to the tank's striped section. Or you could use a {THING:ItemWrench} to attach it to a rocket and take it somewhere distant and dry, then feel good about yourself.

Every <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer's}</color> best friend, the portable generator gets you up and running, fast. Fill it with a {THING:ItemGasCanisterFuel} to power up and charge a {THING:ItemBatteryCell}, or attach it to a {THING:StructurePowerConnector} to link it into your electrical network. It's pressure driven, so functions more efficiently at lower temperatures, and REALLY efficiently if supercooled. Perfecting your fuel mix also makes a big difference.

Philippe Starck might not applaud, but this battery-powered light source undarkens the corners when illumination's lacking. Powered by any battery, it's a 'no-frills' <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Xigo;Xigo}</color> design that can be cheaply fabricated with the minimum of fuss. Unless you like fuss. In which case, fuss all you like.

A portable scrubber does just what it sounds like: removes specific substances from the air. For instance, attaching a {THING:ItemGasFilterCarbonDioxide} will pull <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;CO2}</color> from the surrounding atmosphere. Note that the scrubber has room for one battery and two filters, which will double its operating speed. Neat. When it reaches an internal pressure of 8106kPA, an error signal will flash on the switch, indicating it needs to be emptied. Either vent it directly, or attach it to a pipe network via a {THING:ItemTankConnector} and a {THING:ItemWrench}.
The answer to the age-old question, 'Is there life on other planets?', is 'I guess so.'
Once a chick is hatched, it gets hungry. It will eat soybeans, corn, and wheat, and lay eggs. Some will be fertilized, producing further chickens. Some will not.
Like so many of its bretheren, this is a chicken. A brown one. It will eat soybeans, corn, and wheat, and lay eggs. Some will be fertilized, producing further chickens. Some will not.
It's a chicken, as white as moondust. It will eat soybeans, corn, and wheat, and lay eggs. Some will be fertilized, producing further chickens. Some will not.
While humanity has historically referred to these creatures as 'Greys', they prefer the more inclusive 'Trans-beige' label.
This is a rooster. It is black. There is dignity in this.
The common brown rooster. Don't let it hear you say that.

Portable gas tanks store gas, and gas only. To refill one, bolt it to a {THING:ItemTankConnector} using a {THING:ItemWrench}, then connect it to a pipe network. Try to avoid pushing it above 100 atmospheres, or you'll taste the delicate flavor of regret. Use tanks to fill a {THING:ItemGasCanisterEmpty} by attaching it to the tank's striped section. Or you could vent it into a sealed room to create an atmosphere, attach it to a rover and take it for a drive, or just use it for loud, expensive target practice.
When constructed, this kit places an {THING:StructureActiveVent} on any support structure.
This kit places a {THING:StructureAreaPowerControl} (APC) on any support structure. The APC kit has two options, selecting which direction you would like the APC power to flow.

Harnassing a design pioneered in the early 21st century, the small battery cell is the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer's}</color> basic unit of portable electrical power. While it lacks the charge of a {THING:ItemBatteryCellLarge} or {THING:ItemBatteryCellNuclear}, it has the humble advantage of being fabricated from basic resources.

First mass-produced by <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Xigo;Xigo}</color> in 2155 on the basis of a unattributed prototype, this classic silicon anode power cell delivers almost 300k joules of power. The solid-state design also extends its optimum temperature range.

Illegal on Earth since the Chengdu Event, Norsec nuclear power cells found a new and drastically less safety-conscious market offworld. Pushing the power-weight balance to its limits, the 'nuke' has a 2.3 megajoule charge, reflecting its reliance on exotic <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:IngotsPage;superalloys}</color>.
This kit produces a 5-slot {THING:ItemBatteryCharg}.

Unlike 8-tracks, laser-disks and email, books never totally vanished. Technology may have evolved, but something about the texture and sexiness of the physical book has seen them endure in a unique, if slightly irrational informational niche.

Bodily metaphors are tired and humancentric, but it was Frida Stuppen, the first <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ODA;ODA}</color> Administrator, who said, 'Let the cabling be as the nerve and the vessel, transmitting power and data alike through systems we forge among the stars.' Later commentators suggested that she was simply putting a romantic gloss on a piece of dubious economy. Whatever the case, standard cabling is where any <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer's}</color> network begins. Normal coil has a maximum wattage of 5kW. For higher-current applications, use {THING:ItemCableCoilHeavy}.
A safe and slightly rave-some source of blue light. Snap to activate.
Enliven the dreariest, airless rock with this glowy green light. Snap to activate.
A red glowstick. Snap to activate. Then reach for the lasers.
Snap the glowstick to activate a pale radiance that keeps the darkness at bay.
Dispel the darkness with this yellow glowstick.

Humanity wouldn't have got to space without humble, combustible coal. Burn it in a {THING:StructureSolidFuelGenerator}, smelt it in the {THING:StructureFurnace} to create <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:AlloysPage;alloys}</color>, or use it in the {THING:ApplianceReagentProcessor} to make {THING:ItemSprayCanBlack}. Just don't smear it on your face and do jazz hands. That's not okay.

<color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Recurso;Recurso's}</color> entry-level crowbar is useful in a variety of everyday <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> settings, from opening {THING:StructureAreaPowerControl}s and unpowered {THING:StructureAirlock}s, to splatting pan-dimensional headcrabs, should the need arise.

The <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ExMin;ExMin}</color> Off-whirled Hand Drill has been a companion to <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}</color> for decades. Essential for assembling and deconstructing various items and structures, regardless of gravity, pressure or temperature.

In the distant past, one of Earth's great champions taught a generation of 'Fix-It People' that duct tape was the answer to any problem. <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}</color> have demonstrated that this is truth holds strong, so long as the problem is a damaged {THING:ItemEvaSuit}, {THING:ItemJetpackBasic}, {THING:ItemSpaceHelmet}, or even a {THING:StructureSolarPanel}. To use on yourself: put duct tape in your active hand, hold RIGHT MOUSE BUTTON to automatically repair damage.

Resolving, finally, the question of which came first: it was the egg. If an egg has been fertilized, and is kept between 20C-30C, an {THING:EntityChick} will emerge. For the rest, there is the {THING:ApplianceMicrowave}.
Within, eggs reside in mysterious, marmoreal silence.

When fabricated, the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;CO2}</color> canister is filled a pressure of 8000kPa (80 atmospheres) and coloured default grey. Used as a secondary fuel in the {THING:ItemJetpackBasic}, it can be mounted to a {THING:DynamicGasCanisterAir} or {THING:StructureGasTankStorage} for refill. Careful not to overpressurize when refilling, or it may go 'bang'.

While this byproduct from smelting - sometimes known simply as 'X' - is a toxin, its specific heat makes it a valuable coolant. All gas canisters are full when fabricated to a pressure of 8000kPa (80 atmospheres), and can be mounted to a {THING:DynamicGasCanisterAir} or {THING:StructureGasTankStorage} for refill. Careful not to pressurize beyond 100kPA, or it may go 'bang'.

The portable canister is the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer's}</color> basic unit of <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;gas}</color> delivery. Rated to a standard pressure of 8000kPa (80 atmospheres), empty gas canisters can be mounted to a {THING:DynamicGasCanisterAir} or {THING:StructureGasTankStorage} for refill. Careful not to pressurize beyond 100kPA, or it may go 'bang'. Contains 64L of gas.

The orange portable <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;fuel}</color> canister supplies a 64L mixture of 66% volatiles/34% oxygen for powering such items as the {THING:ItemWeldingTorch} and the {THING:DynamicGenerator}. All gas canisters are full when fabricated to a pressure of 8000kPa (80 atmospheres), and can be mounted to a {THING:DynamicGasCanisterAir} or {THING:StructureGasTankStorage} for refill. Careful not to pressurize beyond 100kPA, or it may go 'bang'.

The green portable <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;nitrogen or nitrous oxide}</color> canister supplies propellent for the {THING:ItemSpacepack} and the {THING:ItemHardJetpack}. All gas canisters are full when fabricated to a pressure of 8000kPa (80 atmospheres), and can be mounted to a {THING:DynamicGasCanisterAir} or {THING:StructureGasTankStorage} for refill. Careful not to pressurize beyond 100kPA, or it may go 'bang'.

The white portable 64L canister is the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer's}</color> basic unit of <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;oxygen}</color> delivery. All gas canisters are full when fabricated to a pressure of 8000kPa (80 atmospheres), and can be mounted to a {THING:DynamicGasCanisterAir} or {THING:StructureGasTankStorage} for refill. Careful not to pressurize beyond 100kPA, or it may go 'bang'.

The blue portable <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;H20}</color> canister has a 64L capacity, supplying water to items like the {THING:DynamicHydroponics} unit, or any other connected system. All gas canisters are full when fabricated to a pressure of 8000kPa (80 atmospheres), and can be mounted to a {THING:DynamicGasCanisterAir} or {THING:StructureLiquidTankStorage} for refill.

Given humanity's obsession with exhaling CO2, all <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}</color> are issued two basic <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai}</color> CO2 filters as part of their standard deployment kit (SDK). These filters allow passage of CO2 into the suit's waste {THING:ItemGasCanisterEmpty}, but are also critical components of the {THING:DynamicScrubber} and the {THING:StructureFiltration}. The {THING:ItemGasFilterCarbonDioxideM} and {THING:ItemGasFilterCarbonDioxideL} are also available.

Filters are used to capture various gases, such as waste emissions from a {THING:StructureFurnace} or {THING:StructureArcFurnace}. Adding <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai}</color>-designed <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;pollutant}</color> filters to a {THING:ItemDynamicScrubber} allows you to isolate this gas, then add it to a pipe network and employ its excellent coolant properties in a {THING:StructureWallCooler}. Try not to inhale.

Filters are used to capture various gases, which can be disposed of or used elsewhere. <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;Nitrogen}</color> is a byproduct of smelting various ores, notably <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:OrePage;ices}</color>, which may be combined with <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;oxygen}</color> to make a breathable - and considerably less flammable - atmosphere.

<color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai}</color> have cornered the market in filter design. Their trademarked templates are simple to print and highly efficient at capturing various gases, which can be disposed of or used elsewhere. Oxygen is a common byproduct of smelting various ores, but must be filtered of such impurities as nitrogen using this filter and various devices, such as the {THING:ItemDynamicScrubber}.

Filters are used to capture various gases, which can be disposed of or used elsewhere. <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;Volatiles}</color> are created by exposing <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:OrePage;ice (volatiles)}</color> to heat. The product can then be collected and combined with <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;oxygen}</color> to create fuel, or used within a {THING:StructureFurnace} to smelt ores and create <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:AlloyPage;alloys}</color>.

<color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai}</color> filters are used to capture various gases, which can be disposed of, or used elsewhere. Water can be collected by filtering smelted <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:OrePage;ice (water)}</color>
This kit produces a {THING:ItemGasTankStorage} for refilling a {THING:ItemGasCanisterEmpty}.
This kit produces a {THING:ItemLiquidTankStorage} for refilling a {THING:ItemLiquidCanisterEmpty}.

A fundamental construction component, glass sheets are created from <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:IngotPage;silicon ingot}</color>. Fabricated on the {THING:StructureAutolathe}, they are used to make {THING:StructureSolarPanel}s, {THING:StructureAirlock}s and many other structures.

There is an enduring paradox at the heart of the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}</color> project: An initiative conceived as 'cut-price space exploration' uses <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:OrePage;gold}</color> as a fundamental ingredient in fabricating so much of its equipment and materiel.

Surprisingly common throughout the Solar System, gold is thought to originate in the heart of supernovas, gathering as dust in the early stages of solar formation, then incorporating into the slowly accreting planetary bodies. Now a prized element in <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> construction, gold is valued not for its beauty, but its reliability: inert, durable, conductive and highly stable, gold's strength is that it does nothing.

Invented by the Romans, who threw Greek Fire at their enemies in ceramic jars, the word 'grenade' is derived from the Old French word for 'pomegranate', as many modern grenades resemble this round, many-seeded fruit. Also like many grenades before it, this one goes boom and breaks stuff.
As the name suggests, this is a hat.

Three centuries of pharmeceutical technology compressed into one small, easy to ingest pill: the Heal Pill, aka the Proton Pill, aka Mr Happy contains active enzymes, therapeutic proteins, modified microbial strains, and mammalian cell line analogues in a single-dose boost of high purity, efficacy, and potency that potentiates a swift parasympathetic immune response.
This kits creates a {THING:StructureHydroponicsTray} for growing various plants.

Water ice can be found on most planets in the Solar System, though not all worlds visited by <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}</color> possess this resource. Highly sensitive to temperature, ice will begin to melt as soon as it is mined, unless kept in the {THING:ItemMiningBelt}. When melting, ice produces a mixture of <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;water}</color> and <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;nitrogen}</color> gas.
This kit creates an {THING:ItemIgniter} unit.
Mysterious in the extreme, the function of this item is lost to the ages.

The most basic unit of construction available to <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color>-kind, iron ingots are created by smelting <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:OrePage;iron ore}</color> in the {THING:StructureFurnace} and {THING:StructureArcFurnace}, and used to create a variety of

Abundant throughout the Solar System, iron is the ore most commonly used by <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}</color> constructing offworld bases. It can be smelted into both {THING:ItemIronIngot}s and {THING:ItemSteelIngot}s.
This kit produces a single {THING:StructureAirlock} portal.
This kit produces a {THING:StructureAirConditioner}, {THING:StructureElectrolyzer}, {THING:StructureFiltration} or {THING:H2Combustor}.
This kit produces a single station {THING:StructureBattery}.
This kit produces a single {THING:StructureCentrifuge}.
This kit produces a range of chute structures, including {THING:StructureChuteStraight} and {THING:StructureChuteCorner}.
This kit produces a single {THING:StructureComputer}.
This kit produces a range of {THING:StructureConsole}s and displays such as the {THING:StructureConsoleLED1x2}.
This kit produces conveyor elements, such as the {THING:StructureConveyorStraight}.
This kit produces a single {THING:StructureCryoTube}.
This kit produces an engine.
This kit produces a single {THING:StructureFabricator}. (Creative Mode only)
This kit produces a single {THING:StructureFurnace}.
This kit produces a range of <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:FurniturePage;furniture}</color>.
This kit produces a single {THING:StructureGyroscope}.
This kit produces a single {THING:StructurePressureRegulator}.
This kit produces a range of sensors, including {THING:StructureGasSensor}, {THING:StructureDaylightSensor} and the {THING:StructureMotionSensor}.
This kit produces a {THING:StructureSign1x1} or {THING:StructureSign2x1}.
This kit produces a single {THING:StructureSleeper}.
This kit produces a {THING:StructureSolarPanel} and several variants.
This kit produces a {THING:StructureStairs4x2} and several variants.
This kit produces a single {THING:StructureStellarAnchor}.
This kit produces a {THING:StructureSuitStorage}.
This kit produces either a {THING:StructureTankBig} or {THING:StructureTankSmall}.
This kit produces a single {THING:StructureTorpedoTube}.
This kit produces a single {THING:StructureGunTurret}.
This kit produces a range of composite wall elements and windows.

The <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer's}</color> best friend, a labeller lets you set names and values on a variety of devices and structures, including {THING:StructureConsole} and <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:LogicPage;logic}</color>.
A charming, if useless, psuedo-weapon. (Creative only.)

Full disclosure, it's not actually 'milk', but an <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero-invented}</color> synthesis of {THING:ItemSoyOil} and {THING:ReagentFenoxitone}, delicately blended in the {THING:ApplianceChemistryStation}. Surprisingly filling, it can be used as an ingredient to cook other <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:FoodPage;food}</color> in the {THING:ApplianceMicrowave}.

Originally developed by <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Recurso;Recurso Espaciais}</color> for asteroid mining, the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer's}</color> toolbelt has room for two <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ToolPage;tools}</color>, seven <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:OrePage;ore}</color> stacks and one {THING:ItemDirtCanister}. While wearing the belt, ore is automatically stored there when mined. Volatile and temperature-dependent remain stable in the environmentally controlled unit.

The handheld 'Topo' tri-cone rotary mining drill was made for one thing: quick digging. Modelled on a classic <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Recurso;Recurso}</color> zero-g design, it functions equally well in vacuum and atmosphere, with cemented carbide bits to increase resilience and bearing life, and reduce spalling. As Jenk Murtons once said, 'The Topo don't stopo.'
A delicious, semi-healthful snack, nothing comforts a <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> 800 million kilometers from home like a hand-made muffin.
This kit creates a {THING:ItemPassiveVent}.

When the sun sets and the {THING:ItemMiningDrill} runs dead, its batteries drained and your {THING:StructureSolarPanel} cold and lifeless, the {THING:StructureAutolathe} empty, the way forward unclear, one thing holds back the endless night of defeat: the trusty pickaxe.

Three centuries of pharmeceutical technology compressed into one small, easy to ingest pill: the Heal Pill, aka the Proton Pill, aka Mr Happy contains active enzymes, therapeutic proteins, modified microbial strains, and mammalian cell line analogues in a single-dose boost of high purity, efficacy, and potency that potentiates a swift parasympathetic immune response.

Through rarely publicized, the existence of this pill is an open secret. For use when all else has failed, the Sayonara Suppository immobilizes and rapidly ends the average <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color>. The delivery mode ensures that if a Stationeer chooses to take this pill, they really have to want it.
This kit creates a {THING:StructurePipeAnalysizer}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructurePipeCorner}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructurePipeCrossJunction}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructurePipeCrossJunction3}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructurePipeCrossJunction5}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructurePipeCrossJunction6}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureDigitalValve}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureGasMixer}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructurePipeLabel}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructurePipeMeter}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructurePipeRadiator}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructurePipeStraight}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructurePipeTJunction}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureValve}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureVolumePump}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureLiquidValve}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructurePowerConnector}.

Reagent mix is pure potential. A slurry of undifferentiated <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:OrePage;ores}</color>, it is output by the {THING:StructureRecycler} and can be fed into the {THING:StructureCentrifuge} to separate and recover the individual materials. Reagent mix is also output by the {THING:StructureFurnace} when the current contents are ejected without smelting a specific ingot.
Designed to burn anywhere in the Solar System, the EZC magnesium fusee supplies its own oxygen to fuel combustion, and dispel the eternal night of space.
This kit creates that miracle of modern science, a {THING:ItemRTG}.
This kit creates a {THING:ItemRTGSurvival}.
A mysterious piece of technology, rumoured to have Zrillian origins.

This standard issue frictional adherence adjustor is a top of the line, bi-rotational model with a columnated uni-grip. It's definintely not just a screwdriver. Use it for construction and deconstruction of certain kits, and setting values on <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:LogicUnitPage;logic}</color> units.
Security cameras can be paired with a {THING:StructureMotionSensor}, then connected to a {THING:StructureConsole} fitted with a {THING:CircuitboardCameraDisplay} for that 'always watched' feeling.
There was a time when humanity really wanted to keep space clean. That time has passed.

The basic space helmet insulates <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}</color> against everything from hard vacuum to weird cooking smells. Providing a pressure-controlled, breathable atmosphere, it comes with a built-in light powered by your {THING:ItemEvaSuit} {THING:ItemBatteryCell}. It also incorporates a lock/unlock feature to avoid accidental opening, as well as a flush function to expel and replace the internal atmosphere. If damaged, use {THING:ItemDuctTape} to fix it, or paint it any colour you like using the {THING:AppliancePaintMixer}.

The basic <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:CHAC;CHAC}</color> spacepack isn't 'technically' a jetpack, it's a gas thruster. It can be powered by any gas, so long as the internal pressure of the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:AtmosphericsPage;canister}</color> is higher than the ambient external pressure. If the external pressure is greater, the spacepack will not function. Indispensible for building, mining and general movement, it has ten storage slots and lets <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}</color> fly at 3m/s, compared to the more powerful {THING:ItemJetpackBasic} or {THING:ItemHardJetpack}. Adjusting the thrust value alters your rate of acceleration, while activating the stablizer causes the spacepack to hover when a given height is reached. USE: 'J' to activate; 'space' to fly up; 'left ctrl' to descend; and 'WASD' to move.
Go classic, clandestine or just plain gothic with black paint, which can be applied to most items. Each can has 20 uses.
What kind of a color is blue? The kind of of color that says, 'Hey, what about me?'
In more artistic <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}</color> circles, the absence of brown is often lamented, but seldom changed.

Green is the color of life, and longing. Paradoxically, it's also the color of envy, and tolerance. It denotes sickness, youth, and wealth. But really, it's just what light does at around 500 billionths of a meter.
Arguably the most popular color in the universe, grey was invented so designers had something to do.
Not so much a single color, as a category of boredom, khaki is the pigmentation equivalent of a mild depressive episode.
Orange is fun, but also suggestive of hazards. Sitting proudly in the middle of the visual spectrum, it has nothing to prove.

With the invention of enduring chemical dyes, the 20th century bestowed associations with innocence and tenderness upon this pale tint of red. Yet classically, it was the color of seduction and eroticism. Things change.
Purple is a curious color. You need to be careful with purple. It can be very good, or go horribly, horribly wrong.
The king of colors, red is perhaps the defining tone of the universe. Linked to blood, royalty, fire and damnation, it is the chromatic expression of power.
White looks clean, sharp and nice. But <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeering}</color> can be a dirty job. White tends to scuff.

A caricature of light itself, yellow lacks the self-confidence of red, or the swagger of purple. It's less fun than orange, but less emotionally limp than khaki. It's hard to know when yellow is appropriate, but it persists as a primary color regardless. Suggesting that yellow gonna yellow, no matter what anyone thinks.

An advanced and stronger version of {THING:ItemIronFrames}, steel frames are placed by right-clicking. To complete construction, use {THING:ItemSteelSheets} and a {THING:ItemWeldingTorch} in your active hand.

Steel ingots are a metal alloy, crafted in a {THING:StructureFurnace} by smelting {THING:ItemIronOre} and {THING:ItemCoalOre} at a ratio of 3:1. It may not be elegant, but {THING:ItemOxite} and {THING:ItemVolatiles} can be combined at a ratio of 1:2 in a furnace to create the necessary gas mixture for smelting.
An advanced building material, {THING:ItemSteelIngot} sheets are used when constructing a {THING:StructureFrame} and several other <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:StructuresPage;wall}</color> types.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureSuitStorage}.

The <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Xigo;Xigo}</color> handheld 'Padi' tablet is an all-purpose data platform, provided as standard issue to all <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}</color>. A dynamic multi-tool that accepts a range of <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:CartridgePage;cartridges}</color>, the Padi becomes an {THING:CartridgeAtmosAnalyser} or {THING:CartridgeTracker}, {THING:CartridgeMedicalAnalyser}, {THING:CartridgeOreScanner}, {THING:CartridgeElectronicReader}, and various other functions.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureTankConnector}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureTankConnectorLiquid}.

If there's one piece of equipment that embodies <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> life above all else, it's the humble toolbelt (Editor's note: a recent <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ODA;ODA}</color> survey of iconic Stationeer equipment also rated the smoking, toxic ruins of an over-pressurized {THING:StructureFurnace} lying amid the charred remains of your latest base very highly). Designed to meet the most strict-ish ODA safety standards, the toolbelt's eight slots hold one thing: tools, and {THING:ItemCableCoil}. Not to be confused with the {THING:ItemMiningBelt}.

In 1934, Enrico Fermi noticed that bombarding uranium with neutrons produced a burst of beta rays, and a new material. This process was named 'nuclear fission', and resulted in cheap energy, the Cold War, and countless thousand deaths. While reasonably common throughout the Solar System, <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}</color> are wary of the material.
This kit creates a {THING:ItemWallCooler}.
This kit creates a {THING:ItemWallHeater}.
This kit creates any one of ten {THING:ItemWallLight} variants.

Stored in the standard issue <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}</color> {THING:ItemToolBelt}, the Arlite welding torch is used to construct a range of essential structures. An upgraded version of the classic 'Zairo' model first manufactured by <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ExMin;ExMin}</color> for modular space habitat assembly, the Arlite is powered by a single {THING:ItemGasCanisterFuel} and designed to function equally well in deep space and deep gravity wells.

A classical symbol of growth and new life, wheat is grown in various <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:OrganicPage;hydroponics}</color> devices. Once harvested, it can be turned into a <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ReagentPage;reagent}</color> using the {THING:ApplianceReagentProcessor}, then turned into sustenance such as a {THING:ItemCerealBar} using the {THING:ApplianceMicrowave}.

Wirecutters allow you to deconstruct various <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:StructurePage;structures}</color>, as well as cross-lay cables when held in your non-active hand, and defuse explosives as needed. Wirecutters are stored in the {THING:ItemToolBelt}, along with other essential <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ToolPage;tools}</color>.

One of humanity's enduring contributions to the cosmos, the wrench represents the essence of our species. A simple, effective and spiritually barren tool, use it to build and deconstruct a variety of <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:StructurePage;structures}</color>.

Motherboards are connected to {THING:StructureComputer}s to perform various technical functions. The <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Norsec;Norsec-designed}</color> K-cops logic motherboard allows <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}</color> to set variables and actions on specific <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:LogicUnitPage;logic}</color>-controlled items.

Motherboards are connected to {THING:StructureComputer}s to perform various technical functions. The <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Norsec;Norsec-designed}</color> K-cops 4474 motherboard is - famously - a solution to the problem of their now-obselete General {THING:StructureFabricator} having a notable lack of buttons.

Motherboards are connected to {THING:StructureComputer}s to perform various technical functions. The <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Norsec;Norsec-designed}</color> K-cops 10-10 sorter motherboard permits <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}</color> to control which items a {THING:StructureSorter} sorter does, and does not, permit to pass.

A relic of from an earlier era of space ambition, <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai's}</color> mothership cores formed the central element of a generation's space-going creations. While Sinotai's pivot to smaller, modular craft upset some purists, motherships continue to be built and maintained by dedicated enthusiasts.
This is your brain on <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}</color>.
Lungs are delicate organs. Keeping them at the correct temperature and pressure is advisable.
An antiquated <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai}</color> transport craft, long since de-commissioned.

Fragments of the original <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}</color> Handbook recovered from the singularity describe the design of active vents: ... active vent is a powered device for maintaining <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;gas}</color> pressure by pumping gas into (or out of) a pipe network. The vent has two modes: 'Outward' sets it to pump gas into a space until pressure is reached; 'Inward' sets it to pump gas out until pressure is reached. The pressure parameter can be set on a connected {THING:StructureConsole}. Default pressure is 101kPa for Outward; 0kPa for Inward ...

Built using the {THING:ItemKitAtmospherics}, the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ExMin;ExMin-designed}</color> air conditioner is used to raise or lower local temperature. The unit has three pipe connections: input, output, and waste. Attach an {THING:ItemActiveVent} to the unit's input port, and a passive vent to the output port, so the unit can draw gas through it. Run pipes from the unit's waste port to outside your base, where you can add {THING:StructurePipeRadiator}s to rapidly shed or gain temperature from the network. Note that some <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;gases}</color> are better coolants than others, but if the coolant pipe has less than 100kPa pressure, it will siphon its output to reach the necessary pressure.
The standard airlock is a powered portal that forms the main component of an airlock chamber. As long as the airlock is not locked, it can be manually opened using a {Thing:ItemCrowbar}.

An Area Power Control (APC) has three main functions. it's primary purpose is to regulate power flow, ensuring uninterrupted performance from devices and machinery, especially those with a fluctuating draw. APCs also create sub-networks, as no devices on the far side of an APC are visible on the main network. Lastly, an APC charges batteries, which can provide backup power to the sub-network in the case of an outage. Note that an APC requires a battery to stabilize power draw. It also has two variants, each allowing power to flow in one direction only.

An Area Power Control (APC) has three main functions. Its primary purpose is to regulate power flow, ensuring uninterrupted performance from devices and machinery, especially those with a fluctuating draw. APCs also create sub-networks, as no devices on the far side of an APC are visible on the main network. Lastly, an APC charges batteries, which can provide backup power to the sub-network in the case of an outage. Note that an APC requires a battery to stabilize power draw. It also has two variants, each allowing power to flow in one direction only.
Unlike the {THING:StructurePressureRegulator}, which closes when the input exceeds a given pressure, the back pressure regulator opens when input pressure reaches a given value.

Providing large-scale, reliable power storage, the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai}</color> 'Dianzi' station battery is the heart of most <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> bases. There are a variety of cautions to the design of electrical systems using batteries, and every experienced Stationeer has a story to tell, hence the Stationeer adage: 'Dianzi cooks, but it also frys.' Able to store up to 1kWh of power, there are no practical limits to its throughput, hence it is wise to use {THING:ItemCableCoilHeavy}. Seasoned electrical engineers will also laugh in the face of those who fail to separate our their power generation networks using an {THING:StructureAreaPowerControl} and {THING:StructureTransformer}.

The 5-slot <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Xigo;Xigo}</color> battery charger fits the {THING:ItemBatteryCell}, {THING:ItemBatteryCellLarge} and {THING:ItemBatteryCellNuclear}, providing up to 500W to any connected cell. Note: the older design means this device has minor power draw (10W) even when not charging.
When it's time to sit, nothing supports you like a bench. This bench is powered, so you can use appliances like the {THING:ApplianceMicrowave}.

Airtight and almost undamageable, the original 'Millmar' series of blast door was designed by off-world mining giant <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Recurso;Recurso}</color> to protect asteroid-mining facilities from nuclear-incident-level explosive decompression. Short of a pocket-sized singularity blinking into the local space-time frame, there is effectively no limit to the pressure these blast doors can contain - ideal for constructing airlocks in pressure-sensitive environments.

Carrying power and data alike, cable coil has come to symbolize the innovation, independence and flexibility of <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> life - so essential, the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ODA;ODA}</color> designated it an official <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ToolPage;'tool'}</color> during the 3rd Decannual Stationeer Solar Conference. Normal coil has a maximum wattage of 5kW. For higher-current applications, use {THING:ItemCableCoilHeavy}.

Carrying power and data alike, cable coil has come to symbolize the innovation, independence and flexibility of <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> life - so essential, the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ODA;ODA}</color> designated it an official <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ToolPage;'tool'}</color> during the 3rd Decannual Stationeer Solar Conference. Normal coil has a maximum wattage of 5kW. For higher-current applications, use {THING:ItemCableCoilHeavy}.

Carrying power and data alike, cable coil has come to symbolize the innovation, independence and flexibility of <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> life - so much so, the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ODA;ODA}</color> designated it an official <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ToolPage;'tool'}</color> during the 3rd Decannual Stationeer Solar Conference. Normal coil has a maximum wattage of 5kW. For higher-current applications, use {THING:ItemCableCoilHeavy}.

Carrying power and data alike, cable coil has come to symbolize the innovation, independence and flexibility of <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> life - so much so, the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ODA;ODA}</color> designated it an official <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ToolPage;'tool'}</color> during the 3rd Decannual Stationeer Solar Conference. Normal coil has a maximum wattage of 5kW. For higher-current applications, use {THING:ItemCableCoilHeavy}.

Carrying power and data alike, cable coil has come to symbolize the innovation, independence and flexibility of <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> duty - so much so, the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ODA;ODA}</color> designated it an official <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ToolPage;'tool'}</color> during the 3rd Decannual Stationeer Solar Conference. Normal coil has a maximum wattage of 5kW. For higher-current applications, use {THING:ItemCableCoilHeavy}.

Carrying power and data alike, cable coil has come to symbolize the innovation, independence and flexibility of <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> life - so much so, the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ODA;ODA}</color> designated it an official <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ToolPage;'tool'}</color>. Normal coil has a maximum wattage of 5kW. For higher-current applications, use {THING:ItemCableCoilHeavy}.

Nothing says 'I care' like a security camera that's been linked a {THING:StructureMotionSensor} and a {THING:StructureConsole} fitted with a {THING:CircuitboardCameraDisplay}. Be there, even when you're not.

If a {THING:StructureRecycler} or unbalanced {THING:StructureFurnace} outputs <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ReagentPage;reagent}</color> mixture rather than the desired <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:IngotPage;ingots}</color>, a centrifuge allows you to reclaim the raw ore.
One of the universe's many chairs, optimized for bipeds with somewhere between zero and two upper limbs.

The <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer's}</color> goal is to make off-world survival less of a struggle for themselves, and those who will follow in their footsteps. Like most <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Recurso;Recurso}</color>-designed systems, chute bins are simple and robust, allowing items to be manually passed into chute networks. They can also be programmed with <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:LogicUnitPage;logic}</color> to operate automatically, although full automation requires the use items such as a {THING:StructureSDBHopper}.

The aim for any <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> is to make off-world survival less of a struggle for themselves, and those who will follow in their footsteps. Chute corners are fundamental components of chute networks, which allow the transport of items between machines with import and export slots, such as the {THING:StructureFurnace} and other automatable structures.

The aim for any <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> is to make off-world survival less of a struggle for themselves, and those who will follow in their footsteps. The chute inlet is an aperture by which items can be introduced to chute networks. Note that its origins in zero-gravity mining means chute inlets are permanently open, rather than interactable, but can be connected to <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:LogicUnitPage;logic}</color> systems to monitor throughput.

The aim for any <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> is to make off-world survival less of a struggle for themselves, and those who will follow in their footsteps. Chute junctions are fundamental components of chute networks, allowing merging or splitting of these networks. When combined with a programmed {THING:StructureSorter}, items can be sent down different paths to various machines with import and export slots.

The aim for any <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> is to make off-world survival less of a struggle for themselves, and those who will follow in their footsteps. The chute outlet is an aperture for exiting items from chute networks. Note that the outlet's origins in zero-gravity mining means they are permanently open, rather than interactable, but can be connected to <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:LogicUnitPage;logic}</color> systems to monitor throughput.

The aim for any <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> is to make off-world survival less of a struggle for themselves, and those who will follow in their footsteps. Chutes are fundamental components of chute networks, which allow the transport of items between any machine or device with an import and export slot.

<color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Recurso;Recurso's}</color> composite doors are rated to 300kPa, which is more than sufficient for most purposes they were designed for. However, steep pressure differentials are not your friend.
While aesthetics rank low on the ladder of <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> concerns, composite gratings allow the concealment of unsightly cables on floors, walls and ceilings.
Air-tight and resistant to extreme temperatures, composite walls favor form over function, coming in a range of slightly different, functionally identical varieties.
Air-tight and resistant to extreme temperatures, composite walls favor form over function, coming in a range of slightly different, functionally identical varieties.
Air-tight and resistant to extreme temperatures, composite walls come in several charming, near identical varieties - reflecting their designer's focus on form over function.
Air-tight and resistant to extreme temperatures, composite walls come several charming, near identical varieties - reflecting their focus on form over function.
Air-tight and resistant to extreme temperatures, composite walls come in several charming, near identical varieties - reflecting their focus on form over function.
Air-tight and resistant to extreme temperatures, composite walls come in several charming, near identical varieties - reflecting their designer's focus on form over function.
Air-tight and resistant to extreme temperatures, composite walls come in several charming, near identical varieties - reflecting their designer's focus on form over function.

In some ways a relic, the 'Chonk R1' was designed by severely conflicted <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Norsec;Norsec}</color> technicians, who needed a unit that could operate with a wide range of <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:LogicUnitPage;motherboards}</color>, while also enduring the worst a new Cadet could throw at it. The result is a machine described by some as 'the only PC likely to survive our collision with a blackhole', while other, less appreciative users regard it as sharing most of its technological DNA with a cheese grater.

This <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Norsec;Norsec-designed}</color> control box manages devices such as the {THING:StructureActiveVent}, {THING:StructurePassiveVent}, {THING:StructureGasSensor} and {THING:StructureCompositeDoor}, depending on which <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:LogicPage;circuitboard}</color> is inserted into the unit. It has a shared data/power port. A completed console displays all devices connected to the current power network. Any devices not related to the installed circuitboard will be greyed-out and inoperable. Consoles are locked once a {THING:ItemDataDisk} is removed.

This <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Norsec;Norsec-designed}</color> control box manages devices such as the {THING:StructureActiveVent}, {THING:StructureGasSensor}, {THING:StructureCompositeDoor} and others, depending on which <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:LogicPage;circuitboard}</color> is inserted into the unit. It has separate data and power ports. A completed console displays all devices connected to the current power network. Any devices not related to the installed circuitboard will be greyed-out and inoperable. Consoles are locked once a {THING:ItemDataDisk} is removed.

This <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Norsec;Norsec-designed}</color> control box manages devices such as the {THING:StructureActiveVent}, {THING:StructurePassiveVent}, {THING:StructureGasSensor}, {THING:ItemSecurityCamera} and {THING:StructureCompositeDoor}, depending on which <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:LogicPage;circuitboard}</color> is inserted into the unit. It has a shared data/power port, and a charming sloped interface. A completed console displays all devices connected to the current power network. Any devices not related to the installed circuitboard will be greyed-out and inoperable. Consoles are locked once a {THING:ItemDataDisk} is removed.
Once, these chairs were the heart of space-going behemoths. Now, they're items of nostalgia built only by a handful of Stationeers with a sense of history. In other words, kitsch.

Originally designed by <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Recurso;Recurso}</color> for ore-shifting, Flexi-belt conveyor solutions can be customized to specific uses for facilitating efficient transportation workflows. In other words, they move stuff between places. An recurring <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> complaint focuses on the fact that every stage of a conveyor system must be individually powered. In the words of Recurso customer service agents through the ages: 'We're working on that.'

Originally designed by <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Recurso;Recurso}</color> for ore-shifting, Flexi-belt conveyor solutions can be customized to specific uses for facilitating efficient transportation workflows. In other words, they move stuff between places - and up slightly, in the case of the riser. An recurring <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> complaint focuses on the fact that every stage of a conveyor system must be individually powered. In the words of Recurso customer service agents through the ages: 'We're working on that.'

Originally designed by <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Recurso;Recurso}</color> for ore-shifting, Flexi-belt conveyor solutions can be customized to specific uses for facilitating efficient transportation workflows. In other words, they move stuff between places. An recurring <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> complaint focuses on the fact that every stage of a conveyor system must be individually powered. In the words of Recurso customer service agents through the ages: 'We're working on that.'

In other words, they move stuff between places. An recurring <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> complaint focuses on the fact that every stage of a conveyor system must be individually powered. In the words of Recurso customer service agents through the ages: 'We're working on that.'

In other words, they move stuff between places.
