In the words of Recurso customer service agents through the ages: 'We're working on that.'

The exact operation of the Longsleep cryotube remains a commercial secret, with <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Norsec;Norsec}</color> merely licensing the design. Able to regenerate organ damage when supplied with power and an atmosphere, the Longsleep is a minor miracle of modern medical technology.

Daylight sensors provide data on whether the current region of your base is in sunlight, and report the exact solar angle. Note that the orientation of the sensor alters the reported solar angle, while <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:LogicPage;Logic}</color> systems can be used to offset it. While the original Stationeer handbook collapsed under its own weight into an infinitely small point, fragments of its wisdom, collected by diligent curators, including information pertaining to sensors, endure in such repositories as stationeers-wiki.com.
The digital valve allows <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}</color> to create <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:LogicPage;logic-controlled}</color> valves and pipe networks.

Capable of manufacturing a vast array of items, the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Norsec;Norsec}</color> General Fabricator was considered too risky by the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ODA;ODA}</color> for widespread use. Certainly, it has been used for purposes beyond those it was intended, including counterfeiting, terrorism, and bad art. As a result, its deployment is now heavily regulated.

The Zyklon Filtration Unit is based on a long-standing <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ExMin;ExMin}</color> system, itself based on older designs of uncertain provenance. It is available in the {THING:ItemKitAtmospherics}. Perhaps ill-named, the device has nonetheless proven indispensible for <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> atmospherics systems, as it can filter two <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;gases}</color> simultaneously from a single pipe network using a dual filter array. The unit has an input, and a filter output as well as an unfiltered outlet for any residual gases.

Few objects or ideas are as clearly and transparently named as the Flashing Light, although fans of scrupulous accuracy have been known to refer to it by its full, official title: 'Default Yellow Flashing Light'.

More durable than the {THING:StructureFrameIron}, steel frames also have several variations for more complex constructions, such as the {THING:StructureFrameCorner} and {THING:StructureFrameCornerCut}. Like iron frames, they are placed then completed by welding {THING:ItemSteelSheets} to the open framework.

More durable than the {THING:StructureFrameIron}, steel frames also offer several variations for more complex lattice constructions. With a little patience and manoeuvring, the corner frame's gothic-inspired silhouette allows the creation of ogival arches and even more ambitious architecture, although they are not airtight and cannot be built on.

More durable than the {THING:StructureFrameIron}, steel frames also provide variations for more ornate constructions. The tilted side frame allows for an almost infinite variety of architectural erections, though is not airtight, rendering it, ultimately, an excresence.

The Zhurong furnace employs a high-temperature gas mixture of <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;oxygen}</color> and <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;volatiles}</color> to smelt <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:IngotPage;ingots}</color> and a range of <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:IngotPage;alloys}</color> as raw materials for <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:FabricatorPage;fabricators}</color>. A basic gas mixture can be achieved by adding {THING:ItemOxite} and {THING:ItemVolatiles} in a 1:2 ratio directly to the furnace, but more complex alloys will require careful management of a dedicated gas mixing network. Exact ingredient ratios must be observed. Likewise, smelting ores at insufficient temperatures will produce <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ReagentPage;reagents}</color>, which must be recycled. If water is present in the furnace, it will gather there until the furnace is connected to a liquid pipe network.
Indispensible for producing precise atmospheric ratios, this gas mixer blends two gases in proportions ranging anywhere from 0-100%.
Gas sensors are designed to monitor and report basic atmospheric information, including temperature, pressure, and gas ratios. They also make wonderful wedding presents.
When connected to a pipe network, the tank storage unit allows you to refill a {THING:ItemGasCanisterEmpty}, as well as read various atmospheric data from the canister.

When connected to a liquid pipe network, the tank storage unit allows you to refill a {THING:ItemLiquidCanisterEmpty}, as well as read various atmospheric data from the canister. It will not accept gas canisters.
A highly regarded professional review site.
An element of an ancient class of spaceship, the gyroscope allowed these vehicles to rotate in at least one of the universe's most popular directions.

The <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero}</color> hydroponics tray is the ideal vessel for growing a range of <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:OrganicPage;plantlife}</color>. It must be supplied with water using a pipe network, and sufficient light to generate photosynthesis. It can be automated using the {THING:StructureHarvie}.
It gets the party started. Especially if that party is an explosive gas mixture.
If a tidy base is the sign of a ordered mind, lockers are the righteous post upon which that sign hangs.

Originally developed to monitor dance marathons, the motion sensor can also be connect to {<color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:LogicPage;logic}</color> systems for security purposes, automatic lighting, doors and various other applications. The sensor activates whenever a player enters the grid it is place on.

Passive vents allow gases to move into and out of pipe networks, which are closed systems unless connected to a device or structure. Passive vents are not powered, merely an aperture, essentially turning an enclosed space into part of the pipe network.

Allegedly the outcome of a weekend father-daughter electronics project by an overzealous {<color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ExMin;ExMin}</color> engineer, the pipe analyzer is essentially a more advanced version of the {THING:StructurePipeMeter}. Displaying the internal pressure of pipe networks, it also reads out temperature and gas contents, and can be connected to a {THING:StructureConsole} or {THING:StructureComputer} via a {<color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:LogicPage;logic}</color> system.

The first thing a Stationeer learns, is that they are alone. The second is that pipes store gas. Pipes spread their contents evenly through the entire network, and can be connected to a huge range of devices and structures. Basic pipes can withstand pressures of up to 60MPa. Beyond that, things get 'interesting'.

The first thing a Stationeer learns, is that they are alone. The second is that pipes store gas. Pipes spread their contents evenly through the entire network, and can be connected to a huge range of devices and structures. Basic pipes can withstand pressures of up to 60MPa. Beyond that, things get 'interesting'.

The first thing a Stationeer learns, is that they are alone. The second is that pipes store gas. Pipes spread their contents evenly through the entire network, and can be connected to a huge range of devices and structures. Basic pipes can withstand pressures of up to 60MPa. Beyond that, things get 'interesting'.

The first thing a Stationeer learns, is that they are alone. The second is that pipes store gas. Pipes spread their contents evenly through the entire network, and can be connected to a huge range of devices and structures. Basic pipes can withstand pressures of up to 60MPa. Beyond that, things get 'interesting'.

The first thing a Stationeer learns, is that they are alone. The second is that pipes store gas. Pipes spread their contents evenly through the entire network, and can be connected to a huge range of devices and structures. Basic pipes can withstand pressures of up to 60MPa. Beyond that, things get 'interesting'.
As its perspicacious name suggests, the pipe label is designed to be attached to a straight stretch of pipe. Users can then label the label with the {THING:ItemLabeller}.

While the Stationeers program has, thus far, inspired little in the way of classical poetry, the following haiku was found etched, ironically, on a piece of pipe wreckage found on Vulcan: "Humble pipe meter speaks the truth, transmits pressure within any pipe"

A simple heat exchanger, pipe radiators can be placed on pipes to shed or gain heat, depending on the temperature of the surrounding atmosphere. If the atmosphere is hotter, heat will be added the gas within the pipe network, and visa versa if colder. In a vacuum, heat will be radiated. The speed of heat gain or loss will depend on the gas in question. Adding multiple radiators will speed up heat transfer.

The first thing a Stationeer learns, is that they are alone. The second is that pipes store gas. Pipes spread their contents evenly through the entire network, and can be connected to a huge range of devices and structures. Basic pipes can withstand pressures of up to 60MPa. Beyond that, things get 'interesting'.

The first thing a Stationeer learns, is that they are alone. The second is that pipes store gas. Pipes spread their contents evenly through the entire network, and can be connected to a huge range of devices and structures. Basic pipes can withstand pressures of up to 60MPa. Beyond that, things get 'interesting'.
Attaches a {THING:ItemKitDynamicGenerator} to a power network.

Controlling the flow of gas between two pipe networks, pressure regulators shift gas until a set pressure on the outlet side is achieved, or the gas supply is exhausted. The back pressure regulator, by contrast, will only operate when pressure on the intake side exceeds the set value. With a max pressure of over 20,000kPa, it requires power to operate.
"Safety third."

The <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Norsec;Norsec}</color>RTG (radioisotope thermoelectric generator) uses the heat output of radioactive decay to generate voltage via a temperature differential across a thermocouple. Normally restricted to low energy devices, the RTG is rumored to exploit Zrillian engineering to achieve its improbably high power output.

<color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai's}</color> standard solar panels are used for generating power from sunlight. They can be connected to <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:LogicPage;logic}</color> systems, in order to track sunlight, but their reduced during storms and when damaged. You can repair these using some trusty {THING:ItemDuctTape}.

As tidy as it is useful, the suit storage rack holds an {THING:ItemEvaSuit}, {THING:ItemSpaceHelmet} and a {THING:ItemJetpackBasic}. When powered and connected to {THING:Oxygen} and {THING:Propellant}, it will recharge the suit's batteries, refill the {THING:ItemGasCanisterOxygen} and your {THING:ItemGasFilterNitrogen} canister. The wastetank will be pumped out to the pipe connected to the waste outlet. All the rack's pipes must be connected or the unit will show an error state, but it will still charge the battery.
Tank connectors are basic mounting devices that allow you to attach a {THING:DynamicGasCanisterEmpty} to a gas pipe network.
These basic mounting devices allow you to attach a {THING:DynamicLiquidCanisterEmpty} to a liquid pipe network.

The mainstay of power generation for Stationeers, this device provides 20kW of power. Multiple solid resources can be loaded. While operating, the device will output its maximum power regardless of whether you have captured it or not. Watch for blown wires! It will output much more power than your regular {THING:ItemCableCoil} can handle.

The large <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Norsec;Norsec}</color> transformer is a critical component of extended <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ElectronicPage;electrical}</color> networks, controlling the maximum power that will flow down a cable. To prevent overloading, output can be set from 0 to 50,000W. Note that transformers operate as data isolators, preventing data flowing into any network beyond it.

Transformers control the maximum power that will flow down a cable subnetwork, to prevent overloading <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ElectronicPage;electrical}</color> systems. Output on small transformers can be set from 0 to 5000W. Note that transformers operate as data isolators, preventing data flowing into any network beyond it.

The simplest smelting system available to the average <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color>, <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Recurso;Recurso's}</color> arc furnace was forged itself in the depths of the Solar System to help explorational geologists determine the purity of potential asteroidal mining targets. Co-opted by the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ODA;ODA}</color>, it now provides Stationeers with a way to produce pure ingots of various resources. The smelting process also releases a range of by product <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;gases}</color>, principally <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;nitrogen}</color>, <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;carbon dioxide}</color>, <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;volatiles}</color> and <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;oxygen}</color> in differing ratios. These can be recaptured from the atmosphere by filtering, but also make the arc furnace a risk in closed environments. Unlike the more advanced {THING:StructureFurnace}, the arc furnace cannot create <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:IngotPage;alloys}</color>.

The foundation of most <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> fabrication systems, the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ExMin;ExMin}</color> autolathe is a multi-axis molecular compositional system. Its complexity demands considerable time to assemble, but it remains an indispensible creation tool. Upgrade the device using a {THING:AutolathePrinterMod} for additional recipes and faster processing speeds.
Use heavy cable coil for power systems with large draws. Unlike {THING:StructureCableCoil}, which can only safely conduct 5kW, heavy cables can transmit up to 100kW.
Upgrade the device using a {THING:ElectronicPrinterMod} for additional recipes and faster processing speeds.
Upgrade the device using a {THING:PipeBenderMod} for additional recipes and faster processing speeds.
Upgrade the device using a {THING:ElectronicPrinterMod} for additional recipes and faster processing speeds.

Transformers control the maximum power that will flow down a cable subnetwork, to prevent overloading <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ElectronicPage;electrical}</color> systems. Output on small transformers can be set from 0 to 5000W. Note that transformers operate as data isolators, preventing data flowing into any network beyond it.

{<color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai's}</color> dual solar panels are used for generating power from sunlight, with dedicated data and power ports. They can be connected to {<color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:LogicPage;logic}</color> systems, in order to track sunlight, but their efficiency is reduced during storms and when damaged. You can repair these using some trusty {THING:ItemDuctTape}.

A device for collecting the raw resources while destroying an item. Produces {THING:ItemReagentMix} containing packages of reagents. Pass these through the {THING:StructureCentrifuge} to gain back the source ores. Plants and organic matter passed through will create Biomass, which when passed through the {THING:StructureCentrifuge} will produce {THING:ItemBiomass}.
Made using {THING:ItemTomato} and an {THING:ItemEmptyCan} in a {THING:ApplianceMicrowave}.
Please note, the organics printer has been deprecated - it is now only spawnable in Creative mode.

The <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Norsec;Norsec-designed}</color>-designed Electrolyzer splits water into hydrogen and oxygen. Employing unknown proprietary technology, the device uses water's latent heat as the energy to drive the electrosis process. If there is a downside to this near-miraculous fission, it's that the device is limited by the quantity of power available, which is used to maintain the temperature output. In other words, the machine works best with hot gas.
This kit produces a {THING:DynamicLiquidCanisterEmpty}.
A tasty food item. Unlike normal plants, it consumes {GAS:Oxygen} and outputs {GAS:CarbonDioxide} and will only grow when not in sunlight.

The <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Norsec;Norsec}</color> jetpack isn't 'technically' a jetpack at all, it's a gas thruster. It can be powered by any gas, so long as the internal pressure of the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:AtmosphericsPage;canister}</color> is higher than the ambient external pressure. If the external pressure is greater, the spacepack will not function. Adjusting the thrust value alters your rate of acceleration, while activating the stablizer causes the spacepack to hover when a given height is reached. The hardsuit jetpack is capable of much higher speeds than the {THING:ItemJetpackBasic} - up to 15m/s. Indispensible for building, mining and general movement, it has fifteen storage slots. USE: 'J' to activate; 'space' to fly up; 'left ctrl' to descend; and 'WASD' to move.
Klaxons allow you to play over 50 announcemets and sounds, depending on your <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:LogicPage;logic}</color> set-up. Set the mode to select the output.

Landing pad capable of handling a small trade shuttle. When connected to a {THING:StructureComputer} containing a {THING:MotherboardComms}, a {THING:StructureSatelliteDish}, and a {THING:StructureVendingMachine} enables the ability to trade with suppliers. You need a communications signal of 95% or above to establish reliable communications with a trader.

Giant communications array that can be used to communicate with nearby trade vessels. When connected to a {THING:StructureComputer} containing a {THING:MotherboardComms}, a {THING:StructureShuttleLandingPad}, and a {THING:StructureVendingMachine}, this allows Stationeers to trade with suppliers. Adjust its horizontal and vertical attributes either directly or through logic. You need a communications signal of 95% or above to establish reliable communications with a trader.

When placed in a {THING:StructureComputer} and connected to a {THING:StructureShuttleLandingPad}, a {THING:StructureSatelliteDish}, and a {THING:StructureVendingMachine} allows Stationeers to trade with suppliers. Adjust the horizontal and vertical attributes of the {THING:StructureSatelliteDish} either directly or through logic. You need a communications signal of 95% or above to establish reliable communications with a trader.
Used for generating power from sunlight. Efficiency is reduced during storms and when damaged. You can repair it using some trusty {THING:ItemDuctTape}.

Designed by - presumably drunk - <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Norsec;Norsec}</color> roboticists, AIMeE (or Automated Independent Mechanical Entity) can be a <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer's}</color> best friend, or tiresome nemesis, or both several times in the same day. Intended to unearth and retrieve ores automatically, the unit requires basic programming knowledge to operate. AIMEe has 7 modes: RobotMode.None = 0 = Do nothing RobotMode.None = 1 = Follow nearest player RobotMode.None = 2 = Move to target in straight line RobotMode.None = 3 = Wander around looking for ores in 15 co-ords radius RobotMode.None = 4 = Unload in chute input or chute bin within 3 meters / 1.5 large grids RobotMode.None = 5 = Path(find) to target RobotMode.None = 6 = Automatic assigned state, shows when storage slots are full
The advanced furnace comes with

RecordThing.Value: Composite Cladding (Angled Corner Inner Long R)
Composite Cladding (Angled Corner Inner Long L)

RecordThing.Description: Apply to an {THING:StructureElectronicsPrinter} with a {THING:ItemWeldingTorch} or {THING:ItemArcWelder} to upgrade for increased processing speed and more recipe options.
Apply to an {THING:StructureAutolathe} with a {THING:ItemWeldingTorch} or {THING:ItemArcWelder} to upgrade for increased processing speed and more recipe options.
Apply to an {THING:StructureHydraulicPipeBender} with a {THING:ItemWeldingTorch} or {THING:ItemArcWelder} to upgrade for increased processing speed and more recipe options.
Apply to an {THING:StructureToolManufactory} with a {THING:ItemWeldingTorch} or {THING:ItemArcWelder} to upgrade for increased processing speed and more recipe options.

The basic <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:CHAC;CHAC}</color> jetpack isn't 'technically' a jetpack, it's a gas thruster. It can be powered by any gas, so long as the internal pressure of the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:AtmosphericsPage;canister}</color> is higher than the ambient external pressure. If the external pressure is greater, the spacepack will not function. Indispensible for building, mining and general movement, it has ten storage slots and lets <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}</color> fly at 3m/s, compared to the more powerful {THING:ItemHardJetpack}. Adjusting the thrust value alters your rate of acceleration, while activating the stablizer causes the spacepack to hover when a given height is reached. USE: 'J' to activate; 'space' to fly up; 'left ctrl' to descend; and 'WASD' to move.

RecordThing.Value: Picture Frame Thick Mount Portrait Small
Picture Frame Thick Mount Portrait Large

RecordThing.Description: The cargo module has capacity for two ten-slot crates. You can have multiple cargo modules on your rocket. The rocket can lift up to seven modules in total. This cargo will be released in orbit and descend the surface of your destination. Unless that happens to be the asteroid belt, in which case it will be left floating serenely in the void.

The command module must be placed on top of the rocket, and will assess the rocket’s readiness for flight. Once all conditions are met, the rocket can be launched when all players are seated in the module by pressing ‘IGNITION’ on the console.
The following conditions must be met for launch:
- Fuel full - Fuel mix ratio correct - a 2:1 mixture of {GAS:Volatiles} and {GAS:Oxygen}. - All players seated - Power supplied to the {THING:StructureLaunchPad} - Fully built rocket
The {THING:StructureModularRocketCommand01} console displays the current state of these conditions. It does not require an atmosphere for lift off - your suit’s atmosphere is sufficient. When landing, the rocket will deploy a lander, and any cargo contained in the {THING:StructureModularRocketCargo01} module.

Adapted slightly from its original <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Recurso;Recurso}</color> design, the H2 Combustor does exactly what its name suggests - it burns a mixture of hydrogen and oxygen to create water. Extremely useful in hot or arid environments, users need to be aware that the combustor outputs considerable waste heat.
Insulated pipes greatly reduce heat loss from gases stored in them.
Insulated pipes greatly reduce heat loss from gases stored in them.
Insulated pipes greatly reduce heat loss from gases stored in them.
Insulated pipes greatly reduce heat loss from gases stored in them.
Insulated pipes greatly reduce heat loss from gases stored in them.
Insulated pipes greatly reduce heat loss from gases stored in them.
Insulated pipes greatly reduce heat loss from gases stored in them.
Insulated pipes greatly reduce heat loss from gases stored in them.

The advanced <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Xigo;Xigo}</color> Padi 2 tablet is an improved version of the basic {THING:ItemTablet}, boasting two <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:CartridgePage;cartridge}</color> slots. The Padi 2 accepts {THING:CartridgeAtmosAnalyser}, {THING:CartridgeTracker}, {THING:CartridgeMedicalAnalyser}, {THING:CartridgeOreScanner}, {THING:CartridgeElectronicReader}, and various other cartridges.
This kit produces varieties of {THING:StructureInsulatedPipeStraight}, which greatly reduce heat loss from gases stored in them.
The modular rocket engine is capable of lifting up to seven modules, including itself.

The rocket fueltank requires a 2:1 mixture of {GAS:Volatiles} and {GAS:Oxygen}. If the mixture exceeds these proportions, or you place other <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;gases}</color> in the tank, the {THING:StructureModularRocketCommand01} console will display an ‘Invalid’ error.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureModularRocketCommand01}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureModularRocketCargo01}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureLaunchPad}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureModularRocketEngine01}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureModularRocketFueltank01}.

{<color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai's}</color> basic solar panels generate power from sunlight. They lie flat to the ground, and their efficiency is reduced during storms and when damaged. You can repair these using some trusty {THING:ItemDuctTape}.

{<color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai's}</color> basic solar panels generate power from sunlight, sitting at 45 degrees to the ground. Their efficiency is reduced during storms and when damaged. You can repair these using some trusty {THING:ItemDuctTape}.
This kit creates a standing solar panel.
The majestic silo holds large quantities of almost anything. While it is doing that, it cannot be deconstructed.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureSDBSilo}.

Use above a {THING:StructureHydroponicsTray} or {THING:StructureHydroponicsTrayData} to manage the planting and harvest of your crops. It contains a button that will allow you to activate it's modes, or connect it to a logic system to do this for you. The modes indicate current growth status of the plant below. Import is used for planting, and harvested plants are sent to export.

Use above a {THING:StructureHydroponicsTray} or {THING:StructureHydroponicsTrayData} to manage the planting and harvest of your crops. It contains a button that will allow you to activate it's modes, or connect it to a logic system to do this for you. The modes indicate current growth status of the plant below. Import is used for planting, and harvested plants are sent to export.

A distant cousin of the jeep, the Mk I {<color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai}</color> electric rover is one of the most simple and durable light vehicles in the known universe. Able to carry two passengers and cargo such as the {THING:DynamicGasCanisterAir} or {THING:Crate}, it is powered by up to three batteries, accepting everything including {THING:ItemBatteryCellNuclear}. A quad-array of hub-mounted electric engines propels the reinforced aluminium frame over most terrain and modest obstacles. While the Mk I is designed for stability in low-horizontality circumstances, if it rolls, try using your {THING:ItemCrowbar} to put it right way up.

<color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero's}</color> leading hydroponic lighting system, the GrowUp UV light supplements sunshine in low light or sun-distant conditions. The unit adds growability over the space of a grid, so requires proximate placement to work.
This kit produces an <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero}</color> {THING:StructureGrowLight}.
This kit produces a {THING:StructureUprightWindTurbine}.

Norsec's basic wind turbine is an easily fabricated, rapidly deployed design that is strong enough to withstand the worst that environments can throw at it. While the wind turbine is optimized to produce power even on low atmosphere worlds (up to 200W), it performs best in denser environments. Output varies with wind speed, and during storms, may increase dramatically (up to 800W), so be careful to design your power networks with that in mind.

A more heavily reinforced version of the iconic {THING:DynamicCrate}, the Crate Mk II is resistant to incredibly high pressures and temperatures. Short of disposing of it in a black hole, the Mk II is about as safe as luggage gets.
This kit produces a {THING:CrateMkII}.
Used for making soups when combined with food in the {THING:ApplianceMicrowave}.
Made using {THING:ItemPumpkin} and an {THING:ItemEmptyCan} in a {THING:ApplianceMicrowave}.
Made using {THING:ItemCorn} and an {THING:ItemEmptyCan} in a {THING:ApplianceMicrowave}.

Diced organic material that is returned when food and organic matter is passed through the {THING:StructureRecycler} and {THING:StructureCentrifuge}. Can be burned in a {THING:StructureFurnace} into {THING:ItemCharcoal} for use in the {THING:StructureSolidFuelGenerator}.

The {<color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero}</color> hydroponics device is the ideal vessel for growing a range of <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:OrganicPage;plantlife}</color>. It must be supplied with water using a pipe network, and sufficient light to generate photosynthesis. It can be automated using the {THING:StructureHarvie}. Note that unlike the {THING:StructureHydroponicsTray}, these cannot be placed consecutively as they are considered devices rather than pure pipes. They do, however, allow data interrogation for logic systems.
A basic fuel.
This kit produces heavy duty solar panels that are resistant to storm damage.
This solar panel is resistant to storm damage.
This solar panel is resistant to storm damage.
This solar panel is resistant to storm damage.
This solar panel is resistant to storm damage.
This solar panel is resistant to storm damage.
A mining belt with 12 slots for ore and three slots for tools.

The Stationeers wind turbine was first designed by Norsec atmospheric engineers, looking to create a wind-driven power generation system that would operate even on exceedingly low atmosphere worlds. The ultra-light blades respond to exceeedingly low atmospheric densities, while being strong enough to function even under huge strain in much more demanding environments. While the wind turbine is optimized to produce power (up to 500W) even on low atmosphere worlds, it performs best in denser environments. Output varies with wind speed and, during storms, may increase dramatically (up to 10,000W), so be careful to design your power networks with that in mind.
This kit produces a {THING:StructureWindTurbine}.
This kit produces a range of liquid pipes.
It's all in the title - liquid pipes create pipe networks for the storage and transport of matter's second state: liquid.
It's all in the title - liquid pipes create pipe networks for the storage and transport of matter's second state: liquid.
It's all in the title - liquid pipes create pipe networks for the storage and transport of matter's second state: liquid.
It's all in the title - liquid pipes create pipe networks for the storage and transport of matter's second state: liquid.
It's all in the title - liquid pipes create pipe networks for the storage and transport of matter's second state: liquid.
It's all in the title - liquid pipes create pipe networks for the storage and transport of matter's second state: liquid.
It's all in the title - liquid pipes create pipe networks for the storage and transport of matter's second state: liquid.
It's all in the title - liquid pipes create pipe networks for the storage and transport of matter's second state: liquid.
Delicious and pure H20, refined from local sources as varied as Venusian ice and trans-Solar comets. Empty bottles can be refilled using the {THING:StructureWaterBottleFiller}.
As its somewhat uninspired name suggests, this device refills a {THING:ItemWaterBottle}, when connected to a liquid pipe network.

The <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Recurso;Recurso}</color> KoolAuger converts various ices into their respective <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:GasPage;gases}</color> and liquids. A remarkably smart and compact sublimation-melting unit, it produces gas or liquid depending on the ice being processed. The upper outlet is gas, the lower for liquid, and while you can attach any pipe you like to either oulet, it will only function if the correct network is attached. It will also only pass gas or liquid into a network if it is powered and turned on. If the KoolAuger is full, it will not accept any further ice until the gas or liquid contents is drained. In this state, it will flash a yellow error state on the activation switch.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureIceCrusher}.

A simple heat exchanger, pipe radiators can be placed on pipes to shed or gain heat, depending on the temperature of the surrounding atmosphere. If the atmosphere is hotter, heat will be added the gas within the pipe network, and visa versa if colder. In a vacuum, heat will be radiated. The speed of heat gain or loss will depend on the liquid in question. Adding multiple radiators will speed up heat transfer.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureLiquidPipeRadiator}.

Loulan, upon arrival you will notice a breathable atmosphere, high enough pressure to sustain life - but a severe lack of it. This sandy giant is situated in the Gargantuan System, moving closer to the black hole situated in the centre each day. While abandoned and no longer green and full of water, this planet still has a functioning atmosphere and you are tasked with scouring the wasteland to acquire the materials and resources needed to survive on this everlasting desert.

So you're stuck on the moon, but it's not all bad.Sure, it's cold, harsh and pretty monotonous, but at least the sun's shining. The solar panel is going to be useful, and the power controller... and probably the arc furnace too. There's even a little food and oxygen in the other crates, though it's definitely not going to last forever. Neither's your battery. You better start thinking about how you're going to survive. How hard could it be to rig up an airlock? A generator? Maybe even smelt some ore and build yourself a base? Looks like you're gonna be here a while.

This is Stationeers Creative Mode!Spawn in any item, test ideas and build bonkers stuff real fast. <color=red>This mode is experimental.</color> Think of it as a freeform space party where exciting and unexpected things* can and will happen, compared to the more reliable near-death experience of Survival Mode. Just don't be sad when you blow yourself into tiny, tiny little pieces or get savaged by chickens or slowly explode while drifting alone into the infinite void. *bugs

A desolate dusty red ball, Mars features more varied terrain that can reach into the sky, and a chilly atmosphere that's no good for breathing, but maybe it can be used for something ...

While the presence of coal isn't typical of Earth's Moon, the relatively flat terrain full of various sizeable craters and lack of atmosphere may be more familiar in this grey landscape. A great location for the budding Stationeer to begin their journey, with fewer of the hazards and complexities offered on more exotic worlds

While there's no gravity or atmosphere, at least there's a lot of space to build! You'll find yourself amongst several asteroids that may contain various ores and ices you can use to survive out here.

Extreme temperatures and ultra-high pressures make Venus no place for the faint-hearted. Only the most accomplished Stationeers will survive on our once-sister planet, now a barren rock. Dig deep, or go home.

Melting some of the ice on this cold world has finally given it an atmosphere, but it's extremely frigid environment presents a serious challenge for the stationeers.The extreme cold will cause batteries to rapidly lose power, so getting a steady power source and warm location are your priorities.
The volatile environment on Vulcan is surviable for very few living organisms, but it's fractured surface and rich mineral deposits make it a risky but profitable venture for enterprising traders.

A world torn apart due to massive tidal forces from the supermassive black hole it orbits. Vulcan offers little hope for any organism that ends up here, but it's fractured surface and rich mineral deposits make it a risky but profitable venture for enterprising traders.Watch out for the deep crevasses that lead to deadly magma flows beneath the surface!

A barren rock nestled under the wing of Saturn's spectular rings. Mimas tiny stature is reflected in its extremely low gravity, and the Mimantean surface is saturated with impact craters from wayward ring occupants. It's distance from the sun provides little power from solar devices.Be very careful when walking or jumping, as you can travel a long way and gain a lot of speed due to the extremely low gravity.

Whether driven by concerns for clarity, safety or simple aesthetics, <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers}</color> have access to a small rainbow of colors for their constructions. These are the color setting for devices, represented as an integer.
0: Blue 1: Grey 2: Green 3: Orange 4: Red 5: Yellow 6: White 7: Black 8: Brown 9: Khaki 10: Pink 11: Purple
It is an unwavering universal law that anything higher than 11 will be purple. The <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ODA;ODA}</color> is powerless to change this. Similarly, anything lower than 0 will be Blue.

Agrizero is an agricultural biotech firm focused on researching and deploying offworld farming technology. The company’s aim is to provide a network of self-sustaining, self-contained 'bio-factories' that will ultimately feed a projected 1 million humans in space. Emerging from the late 21st century's environmental disasters, the firm has roots in China's world-saving artificial farming initiatives, and has now spread to facilities in the Asteroid Belt, where the supply of ice asteroids makes vertical farming and controlled-environment agriculture extremely promising. While many of their facilities are still under construction, Agrizero is already one of the main suppliers of offworld groups like <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ODA;ODA}</color>, <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai}</color> and <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ExMin;ExMin}</color> through the ever-expanding Trader Network.

Asura Biomedia was founded in the early 22nd century by Mumbai-based trillionaire Ashan Gurwaja. Nominally focused on 'biotechnology', the company has always had an ‘elastic’ notion of exactly what that entailed: everything from pharmaceuticals to pet food. Gurwaja's background in bio-engineering firms put the company in the highest echelon of bio-science industries from the very beginning, and it grew exactly as its founder intended: rapidly and reliably, structured specifically to swallow up any smaller firms in its way. Near mid-century, Asura's ambitions evolved to embrace entire health systems – it is now the largest provider of healthcare on Earth, integrating hospitals and primary care with medical supplies, pharmaceutical production and retail, residential care and funeral services. By 2150, Asura's business was a simple proposition, as captured in their famous – if not infamous – advertising slogan: 'We're in you'.

Founded in 2085 to produce weapons for <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai}</color>'s space forces, the company is known for making highly reliable and affordable weapons for off-world use. Their pragmatic approach is reflected in their focus on designs suitable for 3D printing and mass production, as well as a high reuse of components across models and weapon classes. As a result, although CHAC guns excel in no particular category, and have certainly never been accused of gretness, they suffer no great failings, and perform sufficiently well by most known measures to have earned their designers the informal title of 'armorer to the Solar System'.

In the aftermath of the Sisyphus disaster on Mars in 2079, asteroid shifting was officially banned by the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ODA;ODA}</color>. This sea-change forced the newborn space mining industry to reconsider its strategies, but until the opening of the Manaus Space Elevator, marginal economics meant offworld resource extraction was effectively impossible. Formed in 2095 by a long-standing Swiss-German mining conglomerate and a consortium of other interests, ExMin was more an idea than a commercial reality for several decades. Created with the certainty that a space elevator would eventually arrive, ExMin was one of the first to exploit the access it offered. Subsequently it has become one of the Solar System's most powerful commercial entities. With access to space secure, ExMin became a central player in the flow of resources to the Inner System. It has competition, principally from Brazilian mining giant <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Recurso;Recurso}</color>, but the company has never entirely lost its lead on off-world mining. Synonymous with rare earth metals and pioneering off-world resource extraction, it stands at the forefront of development throughout the Solar System.

Officially known as Gewehrfabrik GmbH, GeFabrik is one of the world’s oldest and most highly regarded armament firms, known for producing exceptionally accurate, high-end firearms. In the wake of the European arms manufacturing collapse in the 2030s, a group of unemployed armament staff formed GeFabrik. Dedicated to renewing original design principles, the company is legendary for extensive testing, sometimes lasting as long as 10 years, in order to produce ‘ganz’ weapon formats. GeFabrik is widely regarded as having single-handedly salvaged Germany's manufacturing reputation, while doing nothing for their sense of humor.

Founded by Noboru Hiiragi in the aftermath of the 2110s economic bubble, Hiiragi Communications absorbed several prominent offworld assets, quickly becoming the most widely used trans-Solar System communications network. If you’ve communicated with friends and family offworld recently, it’s been through the Hiiragi network, even if it’s been branded under one of its many child companies. Hiiragi is also the number one seller for PCD’s (Personal Communication Devices) as well as a deep, if difficult to assess investor in terrestrial telecommunication networks.

With its roots in early 20th Century defense industry, Norsec (a.k.a. Northern Security Systems) was an early adopter of asteroid mining – one of its tugs being involved in the infamous Sisyphus Hit on the fledgling Martian colony at Sanders. Norsec was officially cleared of any wrong-doing, but when the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ODA;ODA}</color> banned asteroidal relocation, the company shifted its focus to infrastructure and manufacturing. Norsec’s orbitally-based Space Systems Division is responsible for the design and production of <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ODA;ODA}</color>’s core transport systems, while also being rumoured to hold a large interest in <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ExMin;ExMin}</color>. The company is also noted for its willingness to engage in experimental robotic technology.

In the aftermath of the Earth Crisis, humanity’s focus on space diminished. Yet many felt that, without ambitions beyond our home planet, our species might falter. Created in 2070CE by a newly revamped United Nations, the Offworld Development Agency was given a very specific goal - to guide and encourage human space exploration at a time the cosmos was fading from the public mind. It inaugurated the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer}</color> Program in 2095. Understanding that funding would be difficult to come by, the ODA conceived the program as a slow-burn, low-outlay space initiative. While some derided Stationeers as 'cut-price cosmic castaways', the success of the program is testament to the wisdom and pragmatism of ODA's vision.

This long-standing Brazilian mining group branched into space in the late 21st century. Focused primarily on bulk minerals and metals, the company is perhaps best understood as an extension of the Brazilian government – very few upper echelon political figures in modern Brazil are not implicated in one arm or another of this industrial behemoth. Enmeshment with South American politics has given the company heavy influence over the Manaus space elevator. This deep state control has led to other groups – the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ODA;ODA}</color> included – to exercise a certain ‘flexibility’ toward Recurso. Accusations of illegal asteroid relocation, safety violations and numerous commercial infringements have barely touched it. Meanwhile, defenders point out that very little has been proven in court, and Recurso is hardly alone – hence the truism: 'In space, we all live in glass houses.'

The sole 'traditional' state entity to survive offworld politics, Sinotai’s reach and power is second only to the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ODA;ODA}</color> itself. In many ways a relic – a sub-agency of a staggeringly complicated Earth-bound corporate-bureaucracy – its structure has allowed Sinotai to achieve incredible things. Proving its mettle in the early 21st Century by putting the first humans on Mars, establishing the first offworld gigawatt power system, and the first space-borne fuel refinery, few space-going organisations lack some degree of relationship with Sinotai. A common joke has it that it's impossible to do anything in space without them. Regardless of the truth, Sinotai's approach to off-world development has involved a 'soft power' approach, from MOU's with <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:Recurso;Recurso}</color> (giving them preferential access to the Manaus space elevator) to murkier alliances of convenience with a range of Trader groups.

Originally a defense contractor specializing in brute force, high power weaponry, Tanzanian Kinetic Systems executed a large-scale, peace-time pivot to become the African Assembly’s leading designer of high-speed goods conveyors. Now producing a range of chute network designs and components, TK has a strong offworld presence as a result of the Afro-Sino partnerships in the latter 21st Century. Based in the ‘reconned’ Kigamboni district of Dar E Salaam, the Company regularly enters into development partnerships with <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:CHAC;CHAC}</color> and, as a result, many of their products show distinct similarities. After all, what is a gun but a ‘high speed goods conveyor’.

A 2150CE survey revealed the Xigo 'X' as one of the most recognized symbols in the world. Yet few participants could clearly describe the company's actual scope. Precisely where the company begins and ends has been the subject of endless theories, financial studies and lawsuits – originally a website for price comparisons, the conglomerate expanded to embrace data, then distribution and finally production. It was a seemingly indiscriminate expansion, focused not on one industry, but all of them – taking in so many fields that business analysts have largely rejected the idea of Xigo as a single entity. Rather, it is a conceptual grouping for a branch of human activity. And while such statistics are – by their very nature – difficult to confirm, recent estimates suggest Xigo employs over 1.5% of the entire human race. Suffice to say, it produces almost everything.

In the early 22nd century, Earth was emerging from a cataclysm. Its resources eroded, our population reduced, rebuilding was the spirit of the era. Initiated by the <color=#0080FFFF>{LINK:ODA;Offworld Development Agency}</color> (ODA) in 2095CE, the Stationeers Program was dedicated to a single ideal: keeping humanity pointed at the stars. Stationeers are everything: astronauts, engineers and explorers, deployed with limited equipment and tools, trained to do more with less. Turning the environment to their advantage, their job is to provide infrastructure for humans in space, at a fraction of the cost of traditional space programs. Able to build and maintain bases anywhere from the Moon to Mimas and beyond, Stationeers are our vanguard in the cosmos. Schooled in offworld survival, mining and construction techniques, basic metallurgy, electronics, rocketry, hydroponics and more ‘arcane’ sciences, Stationeers do what they must to survive, and thrive. Renowned for having no entry criteria, there is no such thing as a ‘typical’ Stationeer. Psychological profiling suggests successful Cadets show a ‘baseline’ pragmatism and single-mindedness, but some of the most famous Stationeers possess neither of these qualities. Recruiting from civil engineering backgrounds, military and aerospace industries, software development, mining groups, as well as scientific fields and even religious orders, the Stationeers Program is – fundamentally – open to all humanity.
